p: In addition to stimulating a Th2 response, schistosome infection can suppress T-cell activation [ 84â€“ 86]; S. mansoni uses 2 distinct mechanisms to suppress T-cell activation, resulting in the selective up-regulation of PD-L1 on the surface of splenic F4/80 + macrophages. The presence of fatigued or anergized T cells opens up the possibility for cotherapy of low doses of mAbs against programmed cell death protein-1 (PD-1) or PD-L1 with antibodies that reverse the anergy.
